glsa.title: cpio: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A heap-based buffer overflow in cpio might allow a remote rmt server to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: GNU cpio copies files into or out of a cpio or tar archive.

description.p: Cpio contains a heap-based buffer overflow in the rmt_read__ function in lib/rtapelib.c.

impact.p: A remote server could sending more data than was requested, related to archive filenames that contain a : (colon) character, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All cpio users should upgrade to the latest version:
